trans-unit.source: What are the choices when developing cross-platform apps?.
trans-unit.target: What are the choices when developing cross-platform apps?.

trans-unit.source: Selecting an approach to iOS and UWP app development
trans-unit.target: Selecting an approach to iOS and UWP app development

trans-unit.source: Selecting an approach to iOS and UWP app development
trans-unit.target: Selecting an approach to iOS and UWP app development

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: What are the choices when developing cross-platform apps?
trans-unit.target: What are the choices when developing cross-platform apps?

trans-unit.source: What's the best way to support both iOS and Windows?
trans-unit.target: What's the best way to support both iOS and Windows?

trans-unit.source: Windows and iOS may seem to be very different beasts, but a growing number of tools and techniques can greatly assist you if you need to write apps that support both platforms (and Android too).
trans-unit.target: Windows and iOS may seem to be very different beasts, but a growing number of tools and techniques can greatly assist you if you need to write apps that support both platforms (and Android too).

trans-unit.source: The best solution depends on the type of app you are writing, and whether you are starting from scratch or porting an existing project.
trans-unit.target: The best solution depends on the type of app you are writing, and whether you are starting from scratch or porting an existing project.

trans-unit.source: Writing a new app
trans-unit.target: Writing a new app

trans-unit.source: With a clean slate, you have many options at your disposal, including:
trans-unit.target: With a clean slate, you have many options at your disposal, including:

trans-unit.source: Xamarin
trans-unit.target: Xamarin

trans-unit.source: With Xamarin, you can write your app in C#, have it run on Windows, and create native iOS apps too.
trans-unit.target: With Xamarin, you can write your app in C#, have it run on Windows, and create native iOS apps too.

trans-unit.source: Support for Xamarin is built into Visual Studio; just select the correct project type.
trans-unit.target: Support for Xamarin is built into Visual Studio; just select the correct project type.

trans-unit.source: Apache Cordova
trans-unit.target: Apache Cordova

trans-unit.source: If Javascript and HTML is more your thing, Apache Cordova (aka PhoneGap) will help you create cross-platform apps for iOS, Windows, and Android.
trans-unit.target: If Javascript and HTML is more your thing, Apache Cordova (aka PhoneGap) will help you create cross-platform apps for iOS, Windows, and Android.

trans-unit.source: This project type is also built into Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This project type is also built into Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Game-engines
trans-unit.target: Game-engines

trans-unit.source: With tools like [Unity3D](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=320479) and [Unreal Engine](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=394062) at your disposal, you can write AAA-quality games for Windows and many other platforms, including iOS.
trans-unit.target: With tools like [Unity3D](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=320479) and [Unreal Engine](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=394062) at your disposal, you can write AAA-quality games for Windows and many other platforms, including iOS.

trans-unit.source: Unity supports C# scripting; Unreal uses C++.
trans-unit.target: Unity supports C# scripting; Unreal uses C++.

trans-unit.source: MonoGame
trans-unit.target: MonoGame

trans-unit.source: The spiritual successor to XNA.
trans-unit.target: The spiritual successor to XNA.

trans-unit.source: Now, it's an open-source cross-platform framework, which means you can write apps in C# for many platforms with support for physics engines, and 2D and 3D graphics.
trans-unit.target: Now, it's an open-source cross-platform framework, which means you can write apps in C# for many platforms with support for physics engines, and 2D and 3D graphics.

trans-unit.source: Adapting an existing app
trans-unit.target: Adapting an existing app

trans-unit.source: With an existing iOS app, your options are a little more limited.
trans-unit.target: With an existing iOS app, your options are a little more limited.

trans-unit.source: However, all is most certainly not lost.
trans-unit.target: However, all is most certainly not lost.

trans-unit.source: Windows Bridge for iOS
trans-unit.target: Windows Bridge for iOS

trans-unit.source: Also known as Project Islandwood, this is a still-in-development tool that can import Xcode projects directly into Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Also known as Project Islandwood, this is a still-in-development tool that can import Xcode projects directly into Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Objective-C code can be built and debugged from within Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Objective-C code can be built and debugged from within Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: If your project makes use of libraries such as Cocos for graphics, you might find this a useful way to quickly port your app.
trans-unit.target: If your project makes use of libraries such as Cocos for graphics, you might find this a useful way to quickly port your app.

trans-unit.source: Repurpose your C++ code.
trans-unit.target: Repurpose your C++ code.

trans-unit.source: If your core business logic is written in C++, rather than Objective-C or Swift, you can often use this code with only minor changes in your project.
trans-unit.target: If your core business logic is written in C++, rather than Objective-C or Swift, you can often use this code with only minor changes in your project.

trans-unit.source: You can then use XAML to define your UI, as with other Windows apps, and call into the C++ code when necessary.
trans-unit.target: You can then use XAML to define your UI, as with other Windows apps, and call into the C++ code when necessary.

trans-unit.source: Use ANGLE to run OpenGL ES on Windows
trans-unit.target: Use ANGLE to run OpenGL ES on Windows

trans-unit.source: An intermediate step to porting your OpenGL ES 2.0 project is to use ANGLE.
trans-unit.target: An intermediate step to porting your OpenGL ES 2.0 project is to use ANGLE.

trans-unit.source: ANGLE allows you to run OpenGL ES content on Windows by translating OpenGL ES API calls to DirectX 11 API calls.
trans-unit.target: ANGLE allows you to run OpenGL ES content on Windows by translating OpenGL ES API calls to DirectX 11 API calls.

trans-unit.source: Other cross-platform authoring tools
trans-unit.target: Other cross-platform authoring tools

trans-unit.source: GameSalad
trans-unit.target: GameSalad

trans-unit.source: A game authoring environment.
trans-unit.target: A game authoring environment.

trans-unit.source: Construct 2
trans-unit.target: Construct 2

trans-unit.source: A game authoring environment.
trans-unit.target: A game authoring environment.

trans-unit.source: Titanium Studio
trans-unit.target: Titanium Studio

trans-unit.source: A cross-platform authoring environment.
trans-unit.target: A cross-platform authoring environment.

trans-unit.source: Cocos2D-x
trans-unit.target: Cocos2D-x

trans-unit.source: A cross-platform code library for sprite handling and physics modeling.
trans-unit.target: A cross-platform code library for sprite handling and physics modeling.

trans-unit.source: Impact.js
trans-unit.target: Impact.js

trans-unit.source: An HTML based game library.
trans-unit.target: An HTML based game library.

trans-unit.source: Marmalade
trans-unit.target: Marmalade

trans-unit.source: A cross-platform SDK.
trans-unit.target: A cross-platform SDK.

trans-unit.source: OpenFL
trans-unit.target: OpenFL

trans-unit.source: A cross-platform development tool.
trans-unit.target: A cross-platform development tool.

trans-unit.source: GameMaker
trans-unit.target: GameMaker

trans-unit.source: An authoring environment specifically for games.
trans-unit.target: An authoring environment specifically for games.

trans-unit.source: PlayCanvas
trans-unit.target: PlayCanvas

trans-unit.source: An HTML based game development tool.
trans-unit.target: An HTML based game development tool.
